reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was fantastic, newly renovated and located in a good neighbourhood. The metro was just right across the street so it was very convenient to get to all the tourist attractions. We had no problems walking around at night and felt very safe. The rooms are small, however that's to be expected in Paris. There is a great restaurant right outside the metro station, they have fantastic salads we ate there for lunch and dinner!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel doesn't have a built in AC, they have a mini machine in the room so I would advise to leave the windows open when you're out during the day to let the room breathe.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good hotel, great place, would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Charming!

reviews.text: This hotel is a great little find. Yes the rooms are small but so are the majority of rooms in Parisian hotels unless you are prepared to pay a lot of money. we stayed for four nights and our room was clean, tidy and the hotel team were friendly, welcoming and spoke good English. You get what you pay for in terms of the size of the rooms but that did not effect our enjoyment. Pernety is a great place and ideal if you ant to feel like you are truly in Paris as opposed to a tourist - great little bars and eateries. We highly recommend the Losserand bar and cafe on the corner opposite th metro, great prices for breakfast and evening drinks. There's also three fab places to get croissants and pain au chocolat within moments of the hotel and you only pay a few euros for the privilige.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for the money!

likes.disliked: — Sometimes had to climb stairs if elevator was full

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: Some small two/three star hotels are poor - this is anything but. A great clean welcoming place in a great residential part of Paris. And anyway what diference does a slightly bigger room make when you have the whole of PAris on your doorstep??? We highly recommend this place!

This is a great hotel in a wonderful spot, close to metro to get to all the local attractions. Great bars and cafes around the hotel. Really helpful front desk staff. Nice and tidy rooms, great for families
reviews.title: Lovely spot to explore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is nice, and has a good location, just next to a metro stop. The staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are big enough. The negative sides of the stay is basically the noise from the street, but you will probably get that all over Paris when you open up your window. It also anoyed me that they didnt have something to hold the showerhead up with in the shower/bath combination.
reviews.title: Great deal for the price

likes.liked: — The value we recieved for the price

reviews.text: Some good lunchbars and restaurants in the area. We didn't find any good options for breakfast thogh.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!!

reviews.text: Alright let's face it hotel rooms in Paris are small. That's what we can expect. And although the Kyriad's rooms were a little on the small side the hotel is great.
reviews.title: very budget

likes.liked: — Clean and quiet and in a good neighborhood

reviews.title: Good budget hotel
reviews.text: The place is a little hard to find, or so our taxi driver had a problem. But if this becomes an issue it's one block from the Pernity metro station. If that helps anyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First things first - this is a budget hotel with a budget price, so dont expect huge masses of space or luxurious bedrooms. The room we had was adequately sized (we stayed in the basic room), fully decorated in a contemporary manner and extremely comfy. Yes there were no wardrobes, and you had to live out of your suitcase, but for 3 nights we didnt really care - we were too happy enjoying the sights of Paris! The beds were typically firm but none-the-less comfortable. We would recommend booking a superior room though if you’re willing to splash out a bit more. The hotel location is ideal - based in a real Parisian town rather than a tourist hub where English is the most common language. However, saying this, most people in the local shops/cafes/restaurants etc did know basic English and were more than happy to help. The nearest metro station (Pernety, not Montparnasse) is a stones throw from the hotel entrance. The metro is the easiest and cheapest way to travel, taking roughly 25 -30 mins from Gare du Nord to Pernety. It can be quite hard trekking around with all your luggage, as there were few stations in Paris with lifts/escalators, so you have been warned! Also, none of the Parisians once stopped to help us carry our bags, not even my struggling girlfriend! The hotel does breakkie for 10 euros, which is a waste of money in my opinion - we went to try it out one morning but by 9am they had run out of eggs and sausages, and their pastries were no match for that of the boulangerie next door (well worth a visit!). Instead, we recommend the cafe ‘Losserand’ just up the road – It is modern, friendly and serves fantastic omelettes - the best I've ever had! As we were checking out, a few of the rooms were still in the process of being refurb'ed, but unless the hotel is fully booked, they will now book you into the already completed ones. I would highly recommend this hotel - the staff are helpful and speak quite good English, but do make sure they clarify something for you if you are unsure of what they are saying! Our tips for staying in Paris would be:
reviews.title: Great little hotel - highly recommended!!

likes.liked: — The large, comfortable bed, the great location and the cleanliness of the hotel.
likes.disliked: — Rooms were on the small size, so would have preferred booking a superior

reviews.title: OK - if you're used to the European "standard"
reviews.text: >Take a night bike tour of the city - you get to see the Louvre illuminated beautifully, Notre Dame at sunset, the Eiffel Tower dazzling every hour, and ice cream from the Ile de la Cite – the original center of Paris. The tour also includes a river tour along the Seine and free wine! (Fat Tire Bike Tours 28 euros on their website, or booked in advance on the Eurostar website for approx 17 euros. Definitely worth every cent!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: >Go up the Tour Montparnasse - cheaper than the Eiffel, and with views to match - plus, you actually get a view of the Eiffel and some amazing photo opportunities.
reviews.title: Paris in winter
A Pleasant Surprise
reviews.text: As soon as we can afford it, we will be going back to the Kyriad Montparnasse Hotel, to visit the wonderful Paris once more...
